markdownRemark.html: IoT devices are spread other the world, and are using RF communication most of the time. This talk will be a practical introduction of assessing/attacking such devices over-the-air, and also talk about limitations that could be overcome by mixing various hardware attacks.

frontmatter.title: Introduction to attacking IoT devices using Software-Defined Radio

speakers.name: Sébastien Dudek
speakers.bio: Sébastien Dudek is a security researcher at Trend Micro and is also the founder of the PentHertz consulting company specialized in wireless and hardware security. He has been particularly passionate about flaws in radio-communication systems, and published researches on mobile security (baseband fuzzing, interception, mapping, etc.), and on data transmission systems using the power-line (Power-Line Communication, HomePlug AV) like domestic PLC plugs, as well as electric cars and charging stations. He also focuses on practical attacks with various technologies such as Wi-Fi, RFID, and other systems that involve wireless communications.
